page.title: 12TINKERS THATCH
page.content: MR AND MRS RIDDETT LIVE AT TINKERS THATCH IN MAIN STREET GREAT BOWDEN.THE HOUSE WAS BUILT AROUND ABOUT THE 18TH CENTURY. THEY HAVE QUITE A LOT OF PETS.THEY HAVE TWO CATS, AND A TAWNY OWL. THEY HAVE LOTS OF STICK INSECTS AND 5 MALE MICE. THEY HAVE 1 COCKREL AND 3 BAMTAM HENS.SOME OF THE WALLS ARE MADE OF MUD AND TIMBER FRAME.THE PEOPLE HAVE LIVED IN THE HOUSE FOR 25 YEARS.IN 1910 THERE WAS A ROOM BUILT ONTO THE FRONT OF THE HOUSE IT WAS USED FOR A COBBLERS SHOP AND A POST OFFICE.IT IS NOW USED FOR THE BATH-ROOM.THE KITCHEN WAS BUILT ON THE BACK OF THE HOUSE IN 1954.OVER THE DOOR IS THE NAME PLATE "TINKERS THATCH".MRS RIDDETT FOUND THIS IN A JUNK SHOP.SO IT HAS NO HISTORICAL SIGNIFICANCE.THE ROOF OF TINKERS THATCH IS MADE OF NORFOLK REED.
